topics.body:
I'm going to bitch here for a second.

Apparently the new extremist liberal thing is anti-weight loss.

One of the things they are going after is corsets saying that they don't help lose weight, but the thing is that they haven't done any long term studies on it.  Dumb question, but in order to gauge the long term health effects of something don't you have to do long term studying instead of doing a five minute study on it and then throw it out?

Reason why this is stupid summarized as succinctly as possible:
Organization that in no way is trying to push a social agenda, "Wear this corset for five minutes!"
"okay; done"
Organization that in no way is trying to push a social agenda, "Okay; she didn't lose 100 pounds!  Study done!  Corsets have shown no long term weight loss!"

Personally I wear corsets and I admit they're uncomfortable, but you can not do a five minute study and then claim those five minutes are indicative of long term research!

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557ce3016368725a280005f8#post_557ce3016368725a280005f8
That is true actually.  The whole anti-exercise movement is literally deadly.  If you don't exercise to some level you will die early from some cause.

Even if you aren't overweight and you don't exercise that can literally cause you to have a stroke.  If you spend 10+ hours in a chair daily you *WILL* eventually die of a stroke unless something gets to you first.
